So buying this license entitles you to 3 total activations, not necessarilly concurrently, but in total.

Review.Contenu: All the programs in the bundle (except for 4K YouTube to mp3) have scrambled text/corrupted looking to where I literally can’t read it. *edit* Sometimes it can be read and sometimes can’t, usually exploring the GUI menus makes it scrambled again. I changed the language from system to English, updated my computer like instructed. Still happens and support basically told me to get a newer computer (on OSX Big Sur, I can’t update because of compatibility issues moving forward but they should be able to have an alternative GUI where the text is at least legible, I’ve had other programs do just that). Seems like a fault of the programming to me, but at the end of the day all I know is I can’t read anything (which includes error messages to trouble shoot when contacting support).Edit* I originally thought Tokkit stopped downloading at the 715th video but it saves the ‘likes’ rather than the ‘saves’ which was my mistake. I added a star back to my review because I saw an issue that wasn’t an issue.I was able to download all the Instagram videos I was trying to however— you can’t save the specific collections so it’s kind of a mess. I also can’t search the uploads by uploader which would help me reverse engineer my groups by hand— I can search the caption text under it but not all posts will have that. I value the software  enough to keep the program and I hope they are able to or willing to find solutions for the things I mentioned but not necessarily feeling happy with my purchase.Edit*1. You should be able to find my messages with support, it was only a day or two ago.2. The fact that Big Sur (a relatively recent OSX version) isn’t supported— and the answer to that ISN’T to find a way to support it in the GUI like most software does, but instead for me to have an additional computer with an OSX that is newer than Big Sur is really silly (Big Sur literally came out only 3 years ago). Also it assumes I have two computers.3. I’m aware collections aren’t a feature— I was saying they should be considered (although I don’t know how possible that is) but without it the downloads folder currently is just a mess without some form of organization. I suggested an alternative that should be fairly easy is to include the Instagram user in the downloaded video metadata or title itself.Edit 2*1. Updating their OS …”helped” them… while potentially risking incompatibility with every other program on their system just so they could …read some text? Do you see the issue with that solution?2. I overlooked this before but the ‘saved collections’ feature …while isn’t explicitly stated… it IS heavily implied that the program can save collections. Please consider the impression this page gives. It reads…“Download Instagram Saved Posts and Saved Collections on Desktop in Bulk”And goes on to give steps to do that with 4K Stogram but leaves it very easy to confuse the reader into thinking they can download specific collections in bulk.4kdownload (dot) com/blog/2022/10/31/download-saved-posts-from-instagram--1/Edit 3*It’s up to me to update my OS which is rather recent for a solution that may help… that’s silly. My recent experience with 4K Download (4kdownload.com) left me thoroughly disappointed and frustrated. This platform, which claims to provide efficient and high-quality downloads, failed to live up to even the most basic expectations, making it difficult for me to recommend it to anyone.First and foremost, the user interface of 4K Download was far from user-friendly. Navigating the website was a cumbersome task, with cluttered menus and confusing options. It was a struggle to find the desired features or understand how to utilize them effectively. The lack of intuitive design only added to the frustration of using the platform.Furthermore, the performance of 4K Download was incredibly unreliable. Despite promises of fast and efficient downloads, I encountered numerous issues throughout my usage. The software frequently crashed, froze, or experienced inexplicable errors, disrupting the download process and wasting my time. These technical glitches made it difficult to complete even the simplest tasks, undermining the very purpose of the platform.The customer support provided by 4K Download was equally disappointing. When I encountered problems and reached out for assistance, the response was slow and unhelpful. The support team seemed indifferent to my concerns and provided generic, automated replies that did little to address my specific issues. It was evident that customer satisfaction was not a priority for them.Moreover, the free version of 4K Download was severely limited in its capabilities. While the platform advertises itself as a free tool, it fails to mention that many essential features are locked behind a paywall. This lack of transparency is deceptive and misleading, leaving users feeling cheated and frustrated. The pricing structure for the premium version also seemed excessive, especially considering the subpar performance and lack of reliable customer support.In terms of security, 4K Download raised serious concerns. Given the nature of downloading files from various sources, I expected robust measures to protect my computer from malware or malicious content. Unfortunately, the platform provided little assurance in this regard, leaving me unsure about the safety of the files I downloaded.Overall, my experience with 4K Download was a complete letdown. The confusing user interface, unreliable performance, unhelpful customer support, limited free version, and questionable security practices all contribute to my negative review. I strongly urge others to explore alternative options for downloading software, videos, and other content, as 4K Download fails to deliver on its promises of efficiency and quality.

Review.Titre: This software has one major flaw
Review.Contenu: This software has one major flaw, that can be fixed so easily I don't know why they don't do it. I've written to them about it, but they don't consider it a problem...I let you be the judge When you download a whole YouTube channel 4K Download puts all the videos into one folder with NO dates or numbered system on the file names. So its one big jumbled mess of files in a folder. If its a big channel with lots of videos you can imagine the chaos of the files in the folder being completely random. If you want to watch the files in order its impossible...making the download channel option almost useless.You end up with a bunch videos in a folder with no way of knowing the order they were publishedPlus if you want to come back later to download more videos from that channel, its a pain to see where you left off.This fix is so easy...put YouTube publication dates on the files...or number the files...#1(video file name)...#2(video file name)...#3(video file name)....ectas it is the channel download feature is too much of a pain to useIve used other software of this type and they all had creation dates on the files or they numbered the files, so this request is not some crazy ask...its a basic standard on other softwareOther then that the software works fine and is great for single video downloadsIf they will correct this, ill post a glowing 5 star review

Thoughts after 1,100 downloadsThe new 4k video downloader is outstanding. I used it for free for a very long time and have since bought the professional license (as I do with several paid programs.) The developers are very lenient with the free version, as you can use it forever and the requests to buy a license aren't too invasive. I personally found the license worth it, as it's not a subscription, and it's not that expensive either. The program is also constantly updated which is a very nice thing to have. You also have the option to download as an mp3 file or a couple other audio files.The program does exactly what I want it to do. The only thing I would want to be added is for the video files to be marked with the date they were downloaded (similar to how when you take a photo with a camera, the file has the "date modified" marker on it, which is helpful for sorting what is most recently downloaded while using the file explorer instead of the actual app itself.) I also wish there was the ability to turn off the popup when the program is updated, because every time you update the app, your browser will open and take you to the 4k downloader website saying "Thank you for downloading" regardless of whether you have the license or not, and there's no way to turn it off. Occasionally the program will sometimes switch the download file format to mkv or m4a, which I wish was changed (or a setting to change the defaults) because those two file formats are unusable for me, for various reasons.
